verses.roman:
āṅgopāṅga astra kare sva-kārya-sādhana
'aṅga'-śabdera artha āra śuna diyā mana

synonyms: āṅga-upāṅga—plenary parts and associates; astra—weapons; kare—do; sva-kārya—of their own business; sādhana—as the accomplishment; aṅga-śabdera—of the word aṅga; artha—the meaning; āra—another; śuna—please hear; diyā—giving; mana—the mind.
translation: His plenary parts and associates perform the work of weapons as their own specific duties. Please hear from me another meaning of the word "aṅga."
